nexttext:
where $x \in X \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is the state vector, $u \in U \subset \mathbb{R}^m$ is the control vector (input), $y \in \mathbb{R}^p $ is the output vector, $f$ and $h$ are $C^\infty$ functions.

\medskip
The observation problem can be then formulated as follows \cite{besancon}: \emph{Given a system described by a representation \eqref{sigma}, find an accurate estimate $\hat{x}(t)$ for $x(t)$ from the knowledge of $u(\tau)$, $y(\tau)$ for $0 \leq \tau \leq t$}.

\medskip
The system observability is required for observer design. For nonlinear systems, \emph{global} observability is not practical, since the observer often requires the system to be \emph{instantaneously} observable in a certain \emph{neighborhood} of the state trajectories; the system should be \emph{locally weakly observable}.

\subsection{Observability rank condition}
The system $\Sigma$ is said to satisfy the observability rank condition at $x_0$, if the observability matrix, denoted by $\mathcal{O}_y(x)$, is full rank at $x_0$. $\mathcal{O}_y(x)$ is given by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\Sigma:\left\{\begin{aligned} \displaystyle\dot{x}&\displaystyle=f\left(x(t),u%
(t)\right)\\
\displaystyle y&\displaystyle=h\left(x(t)\right)\end{aligned}\right." display="block"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Σ</mi><mo>:</mo><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnspacing="0pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mover accent="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="right"><mi>y</mi></mtd><mtd columnalign="left"><mrow><mi/><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mrow></math>

prevtext:
where $x \in X \subset \mathbb{R}^n$ is the state vector, $u \in U \subset \mathbb{R}^m$ is the control vector (input), $y \in \mathbb{R}^p $ is the output vector, $f$ and $h$ are $C^\infty$ functions.

\medskip
The observation problem can be then formulated as follows \cite{besancon}: \emph{Given a system described by a representation \eqref{sigma}, find an accurate estimate $\hat{x}(t)$ for $x(t)$ from the knowledge of $u(\tau)$, $y(\tau)$ for $0 \leq \tau \leq t$}.

\medskip
The system observability is required for observer design. For nonlinear systems, \emph{global} observability is not practical, since the observer often requires the system to be \emph{instantaneously} observable in a certain \emph{neighborhood} of the state trajectories; the system should be \emph{locally weakly observable}.

\subsection{Observability rank condition}
The system $\Sigma$ is said to satisfy the observability rank condition at $x_0$, if the observability matrix, denoted by $\mathcal{O}_y(x)$, is full rank at $x_0$. $\mathcal{O}_y(x)$ is given by:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{O}_{y}(x)=\frac{\partial}{\partial x}\left[\begin{matrix}\mathcal{L}^%
{0}_{f}h(x)&\mathcal{L}_{f}h(x)&\mathcal{L}_{f}^{2}h(x)&\ldots&\mathcal{L}_{f}%
^{n-1}h(x)\end{matrix}\right]_{x=x_{0}}^{T}" display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒪</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mo>∂</mo><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mi mathvariant="normal">…</mi></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℒ</mi><mi>f</mi><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow><mi>T</mi></msubsup></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext: $R$, $L$ and $M$ stand respectively for the resistance, inductance and mutual inductance. The indices $s$ and $r$ stand for stator and rotor parameters. $p$ is the number of pole pairs, $J$ is the inertia of the rotor with the associated load, $\omega_e$ is the electrical speed of the rotor and $T_r$ is the resistant torque. ${\mathcal{I}}_s$, ${\Psi}_r$ and $\mathcal{V}_s$ stand for the stator currents, rotor fluxes and stator voltages in the stator reference frame ($\alpha_s \beta_s$) :

prevtext: $R$, $L$ and $M$ stand respectively for the resistance, inductance and mutual inductance. The indices $s$ and $r$ stand for stator and rotor parameters. $p$ is the number of pole pairs, $J$ is the inertia of the rotor with the associated load, $\omega_e$ is the electrical speed of the rotor and $T_r$ is the resistant torque. ${\mathcal{I}}_s$, ${\Psi}_r$ and $\mathcal{V}_s$ stand for the stator currents, rotor fluxes and stator voltages in the stator reference frame ($\alpha_s \beta_s$) :
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{I}_{s}=\begin{bmatrix}{i}_{s\alpha_{s}}&{i}_{s\beta_{s}}\end{bmatrix}%
^{T}~{}~{}~{}~{};~{}~{}~{}~{}{\Psi}_{r}=\begin{bmatrix}{\psi}_{r\alpha_{s}}&{%
\psi}_{r\beta_{s}}\end{bmatrix}^{T}~{}~{}~{}~{};~{}~{}~{}~{}{\mathcal{V}}_{s}=%
\begin{bmatrix}{v}_{s\alpha_{s}}&{v}_{s\beta_{s}}\end{bmatrix}^{T}" display="block"><mrow><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℐ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>i</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>i</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>]</mo></mrow><mi>T</mi></msup><mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true">  </mo><mo rspace="15.7pt">;</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Ψ</mi><mi>r</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>ψ</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>ψ</mi><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>]</mo></mrow><mi>T</mi></msup><mo mathvariant="italic" separator="true">  </mo><mo rspace="15.7pt">;</mo><msub><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒱</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>v</mi><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>]</mo></mrow><mi>T</mi></msup></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E5.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="y=\mathcal{\widetilde{I}}_{s}=\left[\begin{matrix}\widetilde{i}_{s\alpha_{s}}%
\\
\widetilde{i}_{s\beta_{s}}\end{matrix}\right]" display="block"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mover accent="true"><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℐ</mi><mo>~</mo></mover><mi>s</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>~</mo></mover><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>~</mo></mover><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>β</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex1.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathfrak{L}=\left[\begin{matrix}{{L}_{0}}+{{L}_{2}}\cos 2\theta&{{L}_{2}}\sin
2%
\theta&{{M}_{f}}\cos\theta\\
{{L}_{2}}\sin 2\theta&{{L}_{0}}-{{L}_{2}}\cos 2\theta&{{M}_{f}}\sin\theta\\
{{M}_{f}}\cos\theta&{{M}_{f}}\sin\theta&{{L}_{f}}\\
\end{matrix}\right]~{};~{}\mathfrak{R}_{eq}=\mathfrak{R}+\frac{\partial%
\mathfrak{L}}{\partial\theta}\omega~{};~{}\mathfrak{R}=\left[\begin{matrix}R_{%
s}&0&0\\
0&R_{s}&0\\
0&0&R_{f}\end{matrix}\right]" display="block"><mrow><mrow><mi>𝔏</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><mrow><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><msub><mi>M</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo rspace="5.8pt">]</mo></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="5.8pt">;</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>ℜ</mi><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>ℜ</mi><mo>+</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>𝔏</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∂</mo><mo>⁡</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mpadded width="+3.3pt"><mi>ω</mi></mpadded></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo rspace="5.8pt">;</mo><mrow><mi>ℜ</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mn>0</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E6.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\mathcal{O}_{y}^{SM}=\left[\begin{matrix}\mathbb{I}_{3}&\mathbb{O}_{3\times 1}%
&\mathbb{O}_{3\times 1}\\
-\mathfrak{L}^{-1}\mathfrak{R}_{eq}&-\mathfrak{L}^{-1}\mathfrak{L}^{\prime}%
\mathcal{I}&\mathfrak{L^{-1}}^{\prime}\frac{d\mathcal{I}}{dt}-\mathfrak{L^{-1}%
}\mathfrak{L}^{\prime\prime}\omega\mathcal{I}\end{matrix}\right]" display="block"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">𝒪</mi><mi>y</mi><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>M</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtable columnspacing="5pt" displaystyle="true" rowspacing="0pt"><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>𝕀</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>𝕆</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><msub><mi>𝕆</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><msup><mi>𝔏</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>ℜ</mi><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>q</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><msup><mi>𝔏</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>𝔏</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℐ</mi></mrow></mrow></mtd><mtd columnalign="center"><mrow><mrow><mmultiscripts><mi>𝔏</mi><none/><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn class="ltx_font_oldstyle" mathvariant="fraktur">1</mn></mrow><none/><mo>′</mo></mmultiscripts><mo>⁢</mo><mstyle displaystyle="false"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℐ</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><msup><mi>𝔏</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn class="ltx_font_oldstyle" mathvariant="fraktur">1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>𝔏</mi><mi>′′</mi></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ω</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi class="ltx_font_mathcaligraphic">ℐ</mi></mrow></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></math>
